macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indices Hit Record Highs as Markets Start 2026 Strong
items.summary: The Dow, S&P 500, and Russell 2000 all reached fresh record highs to start the year. The S&P 500 gained 1.6% on January 12, with the Russell 2000 up 5.7% year-to-date, driven by a pro-cyclical rotation favoring equal-weight stocks over mega-cap tech.

items.title: S&P 500 Closes at New High Despite DOJ Investigation into Fed Chair Powell
items.summary: The S&P 500 ended January 12 at 6,972 (up 11 points) and the NASDAQ at 23,733 (up 62 points), both reaching new closing highs despite initial weakness from news of a DOJ investigation into Fed Chair Powell related to Federal Reserve building renovations.

items.title: CPI Data and JPMorgan Chase Earnings Drive Market Focus
items.summary: The latest CPI inflation numbers are expected on January 13, providing key insight into inflation trends as 2026 begins. JPMorgan Chase earnings kick off the financial sector reporting season, with analysts noting that only significantly negative results would pressure the strongly bullish market.

items.title: Fed Expected to Hold Rates Steady as Unemployment Improves
items.summary: The unemployment rate improved to 4.4%, reinforcing market expectations that the Federal Reserve will maintain its current interest rate policy rather than cutting or raising rates.

items.title: Tech Giants Show Mixed Performance; Amazon and Alphabet Surge
items.summary: Amazon gained 9.2% and Alphabet rose 4.3%, but Apple fell 4.3% due to funding pressure, reflecting mixed sentiment in the technology sector despite its recent underperformance.

items.title: FTSE 100 Extends Gains on Mining Sector Rally
items.summary: The FTSE 100 rose 1.4% to close at 10,141, extending its year-to-date gain to 2.11%, largely driven by a strong rally in mining stocks after Glencore surged 8.5% on renewed merger discussions with Rio Tinto.

items.title: Dollar Strengthens and Gold Rebounds Amid Market Movements
items.summary: The US dollar strengthened 0.7% while gold rebounded 3.9%, as investors focused on upcoming fiscal stimulus and corporate earnings rather than geopolitical developments in Venezuela and Ukraine.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: RWA Tokens Drag Crypto Market Lower as Bitcoin and Ether Trade Flat
items.summary: Real-world asset (RWA) tokens are pulling the broader crypto market down, while Bitcoin and Ether prices remain relatively stable amid ongoing market pressures.

items.title: The Crypto Company Highlights 2025 Achievements and Outlines Revenue-Focused Priorities for 2026
items.summary: The Crypto Company (OTCID:CRCW) announced key 2025 milestones including $2M in funding, team expansion, a digital bank partnership, digital asset treasury initiation, Starchive acquisition, and debt elimination, with 2026 priorities on organic revenue growth and accretive acquisitions.

items.title: Crypto Mining Pools Evolve into Liquidity Hubs with Collateral-Based Lending
items.summary: Amid falling crypto prices and steady costs, mining pools like ViaBTC are integrating collateral-pledged loans (e.g., BTC, LTC, DOGE for USDT) to provide miners liquidity without selling assets, alongside efficient merged mining for LTC/DOGE.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Meta Announces 'Meta Compute' AI Infrastructure Initiative
items.summary: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg unveiled 'Meta Compute,' a decade-long plan to build tens of gigawatts of AI infrastructure, backed by massive investments including $600 billion in U.S. data centers by 2028 and partnerships for superintelligence pursuit.

items.title: Converge Bio Raises $25M for AI-Driven Drug Discovery
items.summary: AI drug discovery startup Converge Bio secured $25 million in Series A funding led by Bessemer Venture Partners, with backing from Meta and OpenAI execs, to advance systems for antibody design, protein optimization, and biomarker discovery amid surging investor interest.

items.title: Freenome Expands AI and Deep Learning with NVIDIA for Cancer Detection
items.summary: Freenome announced expanded AI initiatives accelerated by NVIDIA to enhance its fragment-level deep learning model for personalized multi-cancer detection from blood samples, addressing large-scale cfDNA data challenges.

items.title: Pearson and Deloitte Form Alliance for AI-Powered Learning
items.summary: Pearson and Deloitte launched a new alliance to deliver AI-powered learning solutions to enterprises and governments, aiming to address the global skills gap with adaptive, continuous learning embedded in workflows.

items.title: DeepSeek V4 Targets Coding Dominance; Musk vs OpenAI Trial Set
items.summary: DeepSeek prepares V4 model to outperform Claude and GPT in coding; Elon Musk's lawsuit against OpenAI advances to March trial over nonprofit mission abandonment; OpenAI and SoftBank invest $1B in data centers.

items.title: BitradeX Launches .ai Domain for AI-Driven Digital Assets
items.summary: BitradeX upgraded to a .ai domain to integrate AI into financial products, risk control, personalized allocation, and ecosystem expansion for smarter digital asset management.

items.title: Forward Edge-AI Expands Partners for Post-Quantum Security
items.summary: Forward Edge-AI grew its global channel partner network to promote post-quantum security solutions integrating AI and quantum-resistant technologies.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Hytale Early Access Release Confirmed for January 13, 2026
items.summary: Hytale, the long-awaited sandbox RPG, has officially announced its Early Access launch today after years of development delays and uncertainty. The release marks the start of a community-driven ecosystem with advanced gameplay systems, creative tools, and modding support.

items.title: Finance Expert Predicts Half-Life 3 Launch in 2026 to Boost Steam Hardware
items.summary: Professor Rob Wilson forecasts Valve releasing Half-Life 3 early in 2026 alongside new Steam hardware like the Steam Machine to drive adoption and generate billions in long-term revenue, ahead of GTA VI's November release.

items.title: Arc Raiders Achieves 12 Million Sales in Under Three Months
items.summary: Embark Studios' Arc Raiders has sold 12 million copies in less than three months, marking a major commercial success in recent game releases.

items.title: Big Daddy Gaming Partners with Casimba Gaming for European Expansion
items.summary: Slots studio Big Daddy Gaming announced a partnership with Casimba Gaming on January 13, 2026, to distribute its debut titles across regulated European markets, following its Swedish licensing approval.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Canon Achieves World First in Inkjet-Based Wafer Planarization
items.summary: Canon Inc. announced a breakthrough technology using inkjet methods to create dramatically smoother wafer surfaces, marking a world first in semiconductor manufacturing processes. The development was revealed on January 13, 2026.

items.title: Tech Investors Eye Gains from Potential U.S. Takeover of Greenland
items.summary: Discussions of a U.S. acquisition of Greenland under President Trump are sparking interest among tech investors due to its rich deposits of rare earth minerals essential for smartphones, EVs, semiconductors, and defense tech. This could secure supply chains amid China's dominance, with stocks like Critical Metals surging.
